citations.narrative:
The primary enclosure for the six domestic rabbits had two water receptacles that contained a small amount of water and
had an excessive amount of shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed rabbits. Water
receptacles for rabbits must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination.

There is an excessive accumulation of fecal matter, waste and debris inside the enclosure housing six adult rabbits. This
is in indication of insufficient cleaning. Accumulation of waste and fecal matter is a source of contamination and an
increased disease hazard to the rabbits. The facility must implement an appropriate cleaning plan to keep the enclosure
free of excreta and protect the welfare of the rabbits.
Corrected at time of inspection.

The food dish for the fennec fox contained food that appeared to be contaminated with shavings and waste.. Food
receptables shall be placed so as to minimize contamination, and measures shall be taken to prevent molding,
contamination, and deterioration or caking of food. Food receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary at all times.
Corrected at time of inspection.

The primary enclosure for the hedgehogs had a water receptacle that contained a small amount of water and had an
excessive amount of shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed hedgehogs. Water
receptacles must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination.
The primary enclosure for the silver fox had a water receptacle that contained water but had an excessive amount of
shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed fox. Water receptacles must be cleaned and
sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination.
The primary enclosure for the serval had two water receptacles that contained water but had an excessive amount of
shavings and debris, and in one container the water appeared very dark colored. This poses a risk of contamination to the
enclosed serval. Water receptacles must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from
contamination.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
3.55  Repeat
   
Watering. 
The primary enclosure for the six domestic rabbits had two water receptacles that contained a small amount of water and 
had an excessive amount of shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed rabbits. Water 
receptacles for rabbits must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination. 
3.56(a)(1) 
   
Sanitation. 
There is an excessive accumulation of fecal matter, waste and debris inside the enclosure housing six adult rabbits. This 
is in indication of insufficient cleaning. Accumulation of waste and fecal matter is a source of contamination and an 
increased disease hazard to the rabbits. The facility must implement an appropriate cleaning plan to keep the enclosure 
free of excreta and protect the welfare of the rabbits. 
Corrected at time of inspection. 
3.129(b) 
   
Feeding. 
The food dish for the fennec fox contained food that appeared to be contaminated with shavings and waste.. Food 
receptables shall be placed so as to minimize contamination, and measures shall be taken to prevent molding, 
contamination, and deterioration or caking of food. Food receptacles shall be kept clean and sanitary at all times. 
Corrected at time of inspection. 
3.130  Repeat
   
Watering. 
The primary enclosure for the hedgehogs had a water receptacle that contained a small amount of water and had an 
excessive amount of shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed hedgehogs. Water 
receptacles must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination. 
 
The primary enclosure for the silver fox had a water receptacle that contained water but had an excessive amount of 
shavings and debris. This poses a risk of contamination to the enclosed fox. Water receptacles must be cleaned and

sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from contamination. 
 
The primary enclosure for the serval had two water receptacles that contained water but had an excessive amount of 
shavings and debris, and in one container the water appeared very dark colored. This poses a risk of contamination to the 
enclosed serval. Water receptacles must be cleaned and sanitized as often as necessary to keep them free from 
contamination. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
